Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Deploy \De*ploy"\, Deployment \De*ploy"ment\, n. (Mil.) The act of deploying; a spreading out of a body of men in order to extend their front. --Wilhelm. [1913 Webster]
Deployments . . . which cause the soldier to turn his back to the enemy are not suited to war. --H. L. Scott. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: deployment \deployment\ n. the arrangement or distribution (of resources such as people or equipment), in preparation for battle or work. [WordNet 1.5]
deployment n : the distribution of forces in preparation for battle or work
